messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re:what have you learned "other ways"?
messages.msgSnippet: I m sure there are more, but here s a start: wool rug braiding soap making knitting sewing house building swimming about horses (my girl s ride) unschooling
messages.messageBody:

wool rug braiding
soap making
knitting
sewing

about horses (my girl's ride)

some Spanish
mountain biking
html and website design

water ski

Angela

messages.subject: Re:what have you learned "other ways"?
messages.msgSnippet: cooking-have made some money from cooking desserts for cafes gardening, permaculture, currently reading about biodynamic gardening car maintenance I ve got a
messages.messageBody:
cooking-have made some money from cooking desserts for cafes
gardening, permaculture, currently reading about biodynamic gardening
car maintenance

I've got a pretty good knowledge of native flora and fauna, years of taking field guides everywhere has paid off , not to mention the kids asking "what's that?" all the time <g>

home renovation
art appreciation

art: drawing, sculpting.... by the way Ren those creativity links of yours at Sandra's site have been manna for my soul.

I've been given a piano so I am learning to play

cross-stitching
yoga
bike riding
horse riding
house cleaning
mothering
problem solving
communication, conflict resolution and all that interpersonal stuff
chess (when I was 11 someone offered to teach me how to play, what they really wanted to do was to feel clever so they used it as an opportunity to humiliate me. 21 years later I finally let Mark show me how to play and I am actually pretty good)
unschooling

Julie
